poem:
### Echoes in Pennsylvania

At Butler fields,  
electrical tales weave—  
screams the ground they step on  
iron eyes meet iron will  
where fortunes speak louder  
than fleeting whispers,  
to honor a moment  
unwritten by fate,  
two shadows unite—  
not in the quiet  
of thought,  
but in the clamor  
of remote engines.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
